meanings.definition: Give official permission for or approval to (someone) to do something.
meanings.sent1: The teacher is authorising the students to go on a field trip.
meanings.sent2: The manager is authorising the purchase of new equipment for the office.
meanings.sent3: The principal is authorising a dance party in the school gym.
meanings.sent4: The judge is authorising the release of the defendant on bail.
meanings.sent5: The government is authorising the construction of a new bridge.

meanings.definition: Attribute something as being done or created by (someone).
meanings.sent1: The artist is authorising the painting to a famous painter.
meanings.sent2: The author is authorising the book to a well-known writer.
meanings.sent3: The chef is authorising the recipe to a renowned cook.
meanings.sent4: The scientist is authorising the discovery to a respected researcher.
meanings.sent5: The architect is authorising the design to a celebrated architect.
